information.habitat: The Blackthorn tree is commonly found in well-drained, damp soil enjoying full sunlight. Although it is commonly found as a hedging plant in gardens, it also grows naturally in scrub, copses and woodland.
information.flowers: Small white flowers emerge in early spring
information.fruits: Black, rounded black fruits known as Sloe berries emerge following flowering
information.uses: Sloe berries are used most commonly as an integral element of Christmas sloe gin. Hawthorn wood has traditionally been used for making walking and horse riding sticks.
